figure.note: Pen and ink drawing: landscape with two buildings
figure.label: Nuestra Señora de ConsolacionOur Lady of Consolation
Venta de Avertura.Country inn at Avertura

div.ab: Quit Toledo Octob 28 fine day at 9h. pass [drawing: arch bridge] & ascend behind the Moorish castle of CervantesSan Servando very steep ascent. On top a moorish building now called St Santa AnaCountry inn.. Venta. has a well & moorish door & garden & olives. The air scented with very aromatic Thyme. Little cultivation. 30 p 1010.30 VillVillage ½ league R hill 1 league Rright. some cultivation. Olives. 35 p 10 Venta BlancaWhite country inn. one house. L & R trees ½ mile distn. 5 p 12 pass between 2 hills, town & castle of Almonacid ruined castle Lleft 8 miles. 17 to 21.43 Villa aminayaVillaminaya probably Amin aga name of the Moor who built it. Houses round courts & wells as in greece. On one an inscriptn AMA A DIOS SOBRE TODAS LA COSASLove God above all things. it is a ruinous place. enter a dry country the people call all this side of the TajoTagus La Mancha. A road L to Mora Town & ruined castle on a hill. 5 to 4 Vill & ruined castle with arms of Castile but Turkish battlements [drawing: crenellations] or [drawing: crenellations] called MANZANIQUEManzaneque. poor village very poor Inn the Alcayde Governor (alcaide). WG has indicated 'de Manzanique'. a very poor man & the curate came to learn the news & offer what they could – The room had no windows bill for 2 & 2 servants 4 dollars & 3 shillings

Octob 29 quit ManzaniqueManzaneque at ¼ p 9h delightful day. At 10h + R & house L of Filistera large old +. a fount at it which seems the reason of building it. 15 p 10 Xcross the river running from it. 10 to 1 Las Carboneras a few
houses & well some Valencians & Murcians exactly in the common Greek dress. Some people of La Mancha with leathern doublets & the rest brown looking exactly like a rusty suit of armour. At 2h = to Consuegra town &[drawing: castle] moorish castle R. 5 p 3 fields of Saffron, blue flowers & enter Madridejos
div.note: WG's translation of the Latin in Miguel Casiri, Bibliotheca arabico-hispana escurialensis..., 2 vols (Madrid: Antonio Perez de Soto, 1760-1770), vol. 1, pp. 208-11.
Ezzeddin Abdelaziz Ebn Abilcassem Babasri in the Library at Granada writes of Samarkand سمرنقدSamarkand thus or rather Amet Ben Vadeh

Lofty Samarcand deserves to be called the glory of Chorasan. the paradise of regions. Are not its towers hung so high that they elude the sight. Like the moon in a grove of trees shady. Like the full moon its rivers are the milky way & its citadels shine like Stars.
Its walls also says Hassan Ben Almonder are like the sun for roundness.
Gothic church of los Reyes Nuevosthe New Kings next after Cathedral. Many little churches built for mosques remain little altered
The AlhajasOr treasures more generally or robes of great ceremony in the cathedral invaluable.
summer hot at Toledo winter mild.
